column4: Hello, my Firefox can't connect to anywhere. I've checked that the proxy is right and also after I found some advice on google disabled ipv6, however it didn't seem to help. I can't even visit sites on the LAN when I punch in the iP. Anyone got any suggestion?
what error do you get when you try?
It takes a long while and after that I get the standard "Can not connect page"
The requested adress is not responding... albeit localized
strange. does NetworkManager report as connected?
Yes, everything else works.
Pidgin, Skype, xchat, etc etc. Epiphany works well for browsing
strange, did it happen after the update to ff3rc1?
No, it wasn't in conjunction to any upgrade things broke. But it is ff3rc1.
ok, then what exactly happened, that caused it to stop working?
can you make a new user and try?
Well I used to connect with a router but now my machine is directly connected which made me suspect faulty proxy settings, but it's set to direct connect
as i said, could you try making a new user?
i'm sorry, you said anything? my net is problematic
Didn't say anything =)
so, the problem is solved?
Sorry about not answering but my problem is more or less solved
oh ok
Thanks for the help
no problem, i didn't help anyway ;) just curious to know, how was it solved/
Well turns out it is a problem with the chroot I am running firefox from rather than firefox itself, though strangely it didn't mind the chroot until recently
